Title: Openswan: Denial of service
Synopsis:
Multiple vulnerabilities in the pluto IKE daemon of Openswan might allow
    remote attackers to cause a Denial of Service.

Background.Text: Openswan is an implementation of IPsec for Linux.

Description.Text:
Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Openswan:

  • Gerd v. Egidy reported a NULL pointer dereference in the Dead Peer Detection of the pluto IKE daemon as included in Openswan (CVE-2009-0790).
  • The Orange Labs vulnerability research team discovered multiple vulnerabilities in the ASN.1 parser (CVE-2009-2185).

Impact.Text: A remote attacker could exploit these vulnerabilities by sending specially crafted R_U_THERE or R_U_THERE_ACK packets, or a specially crafted X.509 certificate containing a malicious Relative Distinguished Name (RDN), UTCTIME string or GENERALIZEDTIME string to cause a Denial of Service of the pluto IKE daemon.

Workaround.Text: There is no known workaround at this time.

P.Text: All Openswan users should upgrade to the latest version:
